[[Image:The Tolkien Calendar 1986 (German).jpg|thumb|Dietrich Ebert’s ''Views of Middle-earth'' (''The Tolkien Calendar 1986'').]]
'''Dietrich Ebert''' (born [[1948]]) is a German designer and illustrator.

Dietrich Ebert was born in St. Peter in the German state of [[wikipedia:Schleswig-Holstein|Schleswig-Holstein]]. As a graphic designer Dietrich Ebert works for several advertising agencies and industrial concerns. Since more than twenty-five years Ebert designs book covers for the publishing company [[Klett-Cotta]]. In [[1985]] Klett-Cotta published with ''[[The Tolkien Calendar 1986 (German)|Der Tolkien Kalender 1986]]'' a German Tolkien Calendar with 12 color illustrations of [[Middle-earth]] made by Dietrich Ebert.
Dietrich Ebert lives and works in [[wikipedia:Reutlingen|Reutlingen]], Germany.

== Tolkien related cover designs and illustrations ==

The following German editions of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]’s works were designed or illustrated by Dietrich Ebert:
* ''Die Abenteuer des Tom Bombadil'' (''[[The Adventures of Tom Bombadil]]'') by J.R.R. Tolkien, Klett-Cotta [[1984]].
* ''Nachrichten aus Mittelerde'' (''[[Unfinished Tales of Númenor and Middle-earth]]'') by J.R.R. Tolkien (Christopher Tolkien), Klett-Cotta [[1996]].
* ''Das Silmarillion'' (''[[The Silmarillion]]'') by J.R.R. Tolkien ([[Christopher Tolkien]]), Klett-Cotta [[1997]].
* ''Das Buch der Verschollenen Geschichten'' (''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'') (Part 1 and 2) by J.R.R. Tolkien (Christopher Tolkien), Klett-Cotta [[1999]].
* ''Der Herr der Ringe'' (''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'') by J. R. R. Tolkien, in one volume (red edition), Klett-Cotta [[2000]].
* ''Der Herr der Ringe'' by J.R.R. Tolkien, in three volumes (green edition), Klett-Cotta [[2000]].
* ''Der Herr der Ringe – Anhänge und Register'' (''[[Appendices]]''), Klett-Cotta [[2000]].
* ''Briefe'' (''[[Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien]]'') published by Christopher Tolkien and [[Humphrey Carpenter]], Klett-Cotta [[2003]].
* ''Der Herr der Ringe'' by J.R.R. Tolkien, special edition (leather edition), Klett-Cotta [[2003]].
